intro: Dolichorrhiza, commonly known as the long-rooted orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique tuberous roots and showy, often fragrant flowers. These plants are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Dolichorrhiza species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in the southeastern United States. Their botanical significance lies in their role in ecological systems and their value in horticultural cultivation.
